author: Daniel Marans
title: Pennsylvania Democrats Decline To Endorse In Senate Primary

author: Dave Boyer
title: Pa. Democrats had vote-counting snag in attempt to endorse Senate candidate

sentence: The primary is divided among four Democrats: Congressman Conor Lamb, who won an intensely fought race for a swingy district in the western part of the state in 2018; Lieutenant Governor John Fetterman, a six-foot-nine Democrat aligned with the progressive wing of the party; state Representative Malcolm Kenyatta, another progressive who is the only Black candidate in the primary; and Dr. Val Arkoosh, the chair of the Montgomery county commission—a crucial Philadelphia suburb.
author: Daniel Strauss
title: Democrats Can Win the Pennsylvania Senate Seat—if They Don’t Slaughter One Another First

sentence: Locked in a tight nominating race with the Northeastern state’s progressive lieutenant governor, John Fetterman, the moderate Lamb has drawn comparisons to Manchin, a conservative Democratic Senator from neighboring West Virginia who has routinely acted as a roadblock to Democratic priorities in Congress.
author: Jarrett Renshaw
title: Pennsylvania's moderate Democrat Lamb distances himself from Manchin

sentence: (WHTM) – A new poll conducted by Franklin & Marshall College shows Lieutenant Governor John Fetterman ahead in the Democratic race for Pennsylvania’s U.S. Senate seat, while Republicans are widely undecided with a large number of candidates still in the race.
author: George Stockburger
title: Pa. Senate Race: Fetterman leads Democrats, Republicans knotted in latest poll

sentence: "To make matters worse, a poll recently commissioned by Lamb’s own super PAC showed his main Democratic opponent — John Fetterman — not just beating him in a primary where the more liberal candidate often has more traction; polling showed Fetterman as the better candidate in a general election, against potential GOP nominees like Dr. Mehmet Oz."
author: Matthew Chapman
title: Biden-snubbed Conor Lamb says 'the race is wide open' for Pennsylvania Senate — but is that what the numbers say?

sentence: Ahead of the debate, catch up on the latest with each candidate who will be on abc27 Thursday night, below: John Fetterman, Pennsylvania Lieutenant Governor While many of the polls recently conducted did not reveal a clear leader in the Republican primary, there has been a consistent frontrunner for the Democratic party — Pennsylvania’s Lt.

title: Pennsylvania Democratic Party Senate candidates set to debate Thursday
